elevator.rmi
Interface Scales

All Superinterfaces:
java.rmi.Remote
All Known Subinterfaces:
Elevators
All Known Implementing Classes:
ScalesImpl
public interface Scales
extends java.rmi.Remote

The remote interface for controlling floor indicators (scales) of elevators via RMI stub.

The interface is implemented by the class elevator.rmi.impl.ScalesImpl. An object with the ScalesImpl class is created to set (or to get) values to the scales of elevators.

The Scales interface can be used to set or get value of scales of all elevators at once, a group of elevators or one elevator. The getScales() static method of the elevator.rmi.MakeAll class is invoked to get a remote reference to the Scales object. For example: 

     MakeAll.init(localhost);
     ...
    Scales scales = MakeAll.getScales();
    Motors motors = MakeAll.getMotors();
    int[] where = (int[])motors.whereAre();
    scales.setScalePosition(where);
It is worth noting that an object with the elevator.rmi.Scales interface allows controlling all scales, a group of scales or one scale, whereas an object with the elevator.rmi.Scale class allows controlling only one scale.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Vlad Vlassov, IMIT/KTH, Stockholm, Sweden
See Also:
MakeAll, Scale, Elevator, Elevators

setScalePosition

public void setScalePosition(int[] number,
                             int level)
                      throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                             IllegalParamException
Set specified scale positions (levels) to scales of a group of elevators.
Parameters:
number - the array of integer numbers of scales (elevators) to be set
level - the integer floor number (level) to be set to the specified scales.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - if failed to execute
IllegalParamException - if level is not a legal floor number, or some element in number is not a legal elevator number.
See Also:
setScalePosition(int), setScalePosition(int[]), setScalePosition(int[],int[]), setScalePosition(int,int)

setScalePosition

public void setScalePosition(int[] number,
                             int[] level)
                      throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                             IllegalParamException
Set a specified scale position (level) to scales of a group of elevators.
Parameters:
number - the array of integer numbers of scales (elevators) to be set
level - the array of integer values (floor numbers) to be set to the scales.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - if failed to execute
IllegalParamException - if some element in level is not a legal floor number, or some element in number is not a legal elevator number, or length of the level array is less than the length of the number array
See Also:
setScalePosition(int), setScalePosition(int[]), setScalePosition(int[],int[]), setScalePosition(int,int)

setScalePosition

                             int level)
                      throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                             IllegalParamException
Set a specified scale position (level) to a scale of the specified elevator.
Parameters:
number - the integer number of the scale (elevator) to be set
level - the integer floor number (level) to be set to the specified scale.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - if failed to execute
IllegalParamException - if level is not a legal floor number, or number is not a legal elevator number.
